@@ -1,1 +88,92 @@    public static final String CONNECTIONS_MAX_REAUTH_MS_DOC = "When explicitly set to a positive number (the default is 0, not a positive number), "
            + "a session lifetime that will not exceed the configured value will be communicated to v2.2.0 or later clients when they authenticate. "
            + "The broker will disconnect any such connection that is not re-authenticated within the session lifetime and that is then subsequently "
            + "used for any purpose other than re-authentication. Configuration names can optionally be prefixed with listener prefix and SASL "
            + "mechanism name in lower-case. For example, listener.name.sasl_ssl.oauthbearer.connections.max.reauth.ms=3600000";

comments.body: is it going to be used for sasl only if so can you make it "sasl.connection.max.reauth.ms"
@rajinisivaram I believe there was a desire to keep our options open in this regard and not mention SASL explicitly -- thoughts?

Yes, since this config is used by the broker to force reauthentication using connection termination as well, there is no reason why we can't apply it for SSL as well in future. So it makes sense to keep it neutral.
